title: Authors and Citation
Authors and Citation
text: Kenny C (2025). ggtiger: Princeton Themes 'ggplot2'. R package version 0.0.0.9000, http://christophertkenny.com/ggtiger/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ggtiger: Princeton Themes for 'ggplot2'},   author = {Christopher T. Kenny},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {http://christophertkenny.com/ggtiger/}, }

title: Princeton Themes for ggplot2
text: ggtiger offers setup ggplot2 follows Princeton University brand guidelines, possible. fonts must sourced Office Communications, search locally first. none available, uses secondary fonts brand guidelines downloads Google Fonts necessary. contains several color palettes, designed “infographics” Office Communications.

title: Princeton Themes for ggplot2
text: can install development version ggtiger GitHub :

title: Princeton Themes for ggplot2
text: package attempts capture Princeton University brand guidelines making plots ggplot2.  color schemes included princeton, list palette vectors.
code: library(ggtiger) library(ggplot2)  mpg |>    ggplot() +   geom_density(aes(x = cty, fill = factor(cyl)), alpha = 0.8) +   labs(     title = 'Density plot',     subtitle = 'City Mileage Grouped by Number of cylinders',     caption = 'Source: mpg',     x = 'City Mileage',     fill = '# Cylinders'   ) +   facet_wrap(~ (hwy > 29)) +   scale_fill_princeton_d() +   theme_princeton() #> core #> neutrals #> coreplus #> categorical #> diverging #> sequential_orange #> sequential_red #> sequential_olive #> sequential_sky_blue #> sequential_royal_blue #> sequential_grey_blue #> sequential_yellow #> sequential_pink #> sequential_grey #> sequential_magenta

what: Scales consistent with Princeton Brand Template — scale_color_princeton_c
title: Scales consistent with Princeton Brand Template — scale_color_princeton_c
Scales consistent with Princeton Brand Template — scale_color_princeton_c
code: scale_color_princeton_c(palette = "sequential_orange", ...)  scale_fill_princeton_c(   palette = "sequential_orange",   na.color = "#5b575d",   ... )  scale_color_princeton_b(   palette = "sequential_orange",   na.color = "#5b575d",   ... )  scale_fill_princeton_b(   palette = "sequential_orange",   na.color = "#5b575d",   ... )  scale_color_princeton_d(palette = "core", ...)  scale_fill_princeton_d(palette = "core", ...)  scale_colour_princeton_d(palette = "core", ...)  scale_colour_princeton_c(palette = "sequential_orange", ...)  scale_colour_princeton_b(   palette = "sequential_orange",   na.color = "#5b575d",   ... )

title: Scales consistent with Princeton Brand Template — scale_color_princeton_c
text: palette Name palette use. See princeton available palettes. ... Additional arguments pass ggplot2::binned_scale _b, ggplot2::continuous_scale _c, ggplot2::discrete_scale _d na.color Color use NA values (_b scales)

title: Scales consistent with Princeton Brand Template — scale_color_princeton_c
Scales consistent with Princeton Brand Template — scale_color_princeton_c
code: library(ggplot2)  ggplot(mpg, aes(cty)) +   geom_density(aes(fill = factor(cyl)), alpha = 0.8) +   labs(     title = 'Density plot',     subtitle = 'City Mileage Grouped by Number of cylinders',     caption = 'Source: mpg',     x = 'City Mileage',     fill = '# Cylinders'   ) +   facet_wrap(~ (hwy > 29)) +   scale_fill_princeton_d() +   theme_princeton()

code: theme_princeton(   princeton_font = TRUE,   title_family = NULL,   base_family = NULL,   ... )

title: A theme based on Princeton University design guidelines — theme_princeton
text: princeton_font Princeton fonts used available? title_family Font family titles. search locally fonts base_family Font family base text ... Additional arguments pass ggplot2::theme()

title: A theme based on Princeton University design guidelines — theme_princeton
